item.title: Getting Started
item.description: System requirements macOS 11 Big Sur or later Installation Download dmg file from here. Open a downloaded dmg file. Move TrueWidget.app into Applications. Open TrueWidget from Launchpad. A menu bar icon will be added and the application window will appear. What’s next? Configuration

item.title: How to quit TrueWidget
item.description: TrueWidget keeps running in the background even if you close the Settings window. To quit TrueWidget, choose “Quit TrueWidget” from the menu bar. Note If you’ve hidden the menu bar icon, you can also quit TrueWidget from Settings. Open Settings. Press Quit TrueWidget button.

item.title: Open Settings
item.description: Open Settings from the menu bar. Note If you’ve hidden the menu bar icon, open TrueWidget again from Launchpad while TrueWidget is already running to open Settings.

item.title: How to uninstall TrueWidget
item.description: Remove TrueWidget from your system as follows. Quit TrueWidget before uninstallaion. Open Applications folder in Finder, then move TrueWidget to trash.

item.title: Layout configuration
item.description: You can change the position and appearance. Position and size Position Opacity Clear Colored Multiple displays Specifies which screen to display when multiple displays are used. Operation System Xcode CPU Usage Time

item.title: Downgrade to older version
item.description: Download an older version from Release notes and install it.

item.title: Open at login
item.description: You can launch TrueWidget automaticaly at login. Open Settings. Enable Open at login.

item.title: Hide the icon in menu bar
item.description: You can hide the icon in menu bar from preferences. Open Settings. Turn off Show icon in menu bar.

item.title: Use beta version
item.description: You can install beta version from Check for beta updates button on Misc tab.

item.title: Pricing
item.description: TrueWidget is an open source software and you can use it without any purchases.
